body_html:
@rudedogg I'm afraid that rolled binary distributions might not solve the issue. Pytorch is successfully becoming a dependency to critical cutting edge libraries in data science. NVIDIA has had issues with Apple for a while now. There's a lack of priority in CUDA support for Mac computers.
No intent to polemize, it would be just good to see the pytorch team bring this issue to the right people at NVIDIA, a company that is actually affiliated with the project and is not, as suggested before, some entire third party. This is a seriously delaying issue to any scientist on a Mac.

body:
@rudedogg I'm afraid that rolled binary distributions might not solve the issue. Pytorch is successfully becoming a dependency to critical cutting edge libraries in data science. NVIDIA [has had](https://appleinsider.com/articles/17/04/04/why-apples-new-gpu-efforts-are-a-major-disruptive-threat-to-nvidia) [issues](https://arstechnica.com/gadgets/2009/06/nvidia-gpu-failure-fallout-continues-apple-extends-warranty/) with Apple for a while now. There's a lack of priority in CUDA support for Mac computers. 
No intent to polemize, it would be just good to see the pytorch team bring this issue to the right people at NVIDIA, [a company that is actually affiliated with the project and is not,](http://pytorch) as suggested before, some entire third party.  This is a seriously delaying issue to any scientist on a Mac.
